taskDescription: The FDA recommends that you consume less than 0.5 g of caffeine daily. A cup of coffee contains 95 mg of caffeine and a can of soda contains 54 mg. If you drink 2 cups of coffee and 3 cans of soda, have you kept your dayâ€™s caffeine consumption to the FDA recommendation? Explain.
detailedSolution: Yes, 352 mg of caffeine is equal to 0.352 g, which is less than 0.5 g.
